title: JSON Schema for service parameters used in BTPSA
description: User and landscape specific parameters to be used when executing use cases

btpcliapihostregion.description: host region for the BTP CLI calls
btpcliapihostregion.title: host region for the BTP CLI calls

cfcliapihostregion.description: host region for the Cloud Foundry CLI (normally the same as 'region'). In case of errors you might have to set this to e.g. 'eu10-004' (check CF API in your SAP BTP cockpit in the sub account and CF environment).
cfcliapihostregion.title: host region for the Cloud Foundry CLI calls

cfLandscape.description: landscape of the Cloud Foundry environment to be used for your use case (e.g. cf-eu10-004)
cfLandscape.title: landscape of the CF environment for use case

cfspacename.description: name for the Cloudfoundry space to be used for your use case
cfspacename.title: name for the CF space

cfspacequota.description: space quota definition for the cf space
cfspacequota.title: CF space quota

createQuotaPlan.description: if set to true, a new quota plan will be created
createQuotaPlan.title: create new quota plan

spaceQuotaAllowPaidServicePlans.description: if set to true, paid service plans are allowed
spaceQuotaAllowPaidServicePlans.title: allow paid service plans

spaceQuotaAppInstances.description: total number of application instances. -1 represents an unlimited amount.
spaceQuotaAppInstances.title: total number of application instances

spaceQuotaInstanceMemory.description: instance memory limit for the quota plan
spaceQuotaInstanceMemory.title: instance memory limit for quota plan

spaceQuotaName.description: name of the quota plan to be created
spaceQuotaName.title: name of the quota plan

spaceQuotaReservedRoutePorts.description: maximum number of routes that may be created with reserved ports
spaceQuotaReservedRoutePorts.title: maximum number of reserved routes

spaceQuotaRoutes.description: total number of routes for the quota plan
spaceQuotaRoutes.title: total number of routes for quota plan

spaceQuotaServiceInstances.description: total number of service instances for the quota plan
spaceQuotaServiceInstances.title: total number of service instances for quota plan

spaceQuotaTotalMemory.description: total memory limit for the quota plan
spaceQuotaTotalMemory.title: total memory limit for quota plan

clusterregion.description: region for the SAP BTP Kyma runtime cluster. This parameter is used as default for Kyma cluster creation. Override via usecase.json possible
clusterregion.title: region for SAP BTP Kyma runtime cluster

customAppProviderSubaccountId.description: id of provider sub account of custom app
customAppProviderSubaccountId.title: provider subaccount id of custom app on SAP BTP

directoryid.description: id of the directory that should be used
directoryid.title: directory id in SAP BTP global account

directoryname.description: name of your directory in case you want to define a specific name for it
directoryname.title: directory name for use case

envvariables.description: list of environment variables on OS level to be used within commands defined in the `executeBeforeAccountSetup` and `executeAfterAccountSetup`.
envvariables.title: list of environment variables on OS level to be used within commands defined in the `executeBeforeAccountSetup` and `executeAfterAccountSetup`.

fallbackserviceplan.description: if defined, the tool will use the defined name as fallback service plan, if the plan defined in the use case is not supported
fallbackserviceplan.title: fallback service plan, if the plan defined in the use case is not supported

globalaccount.description: the 'subdomain id' of your SAP BTP global account (please check it in the SAP BTP cockpit)
globalaccount.title: your SAP BTP global account

iashost.description: IAS host for your SAP BTP sub account in case you want to make use of it in your use case (create a service instance for service 'xsuaa' and plan 'apiaccess')
iashost.title: IAS host for your SAP BTP sub account

k8snamespace.description: name for the Kubernetes namespace to be used for your use case
k8snamespace.title: name for the Kubernetes namespace

kubeconfigpath.description: path to kubeconfig file to be used for your use case
kubeconfigpath.title: path to kubeconfig file

logcommands.description: if set to True, the script will log all commands sent to the SAP BTP account. If set to False it won't
logcommands.title: log all commands sent to your SAP BTP account

loginmethod.title: login method to SAP BTP
loginmethod.description: if set to sso, you'll need to open a link provided in a browser to login. Set to basicAuthentication (default) the script will ask if you want to provide username and password. If set to **envVariables** you need to provide the email address and password by setting the environment variable **BTPSA_PARAM_MYEMAIL** and **BTPSA_PARAM_MYPASSWORD**. In addition you can as well provide the global account through the environment variable **BTPSA_PARAM_GLOBALACCOUNT**. Like this: export BTPSA_PARAM_MYEMAIL=youremail@x.com

myemail.description: Email address you use to access your SAP BTP account
myemail.title: Your email address

mypassword.description: password for the user of your SAP BTP account (USE WITH CARE!)
mypassword.title: password for the user of your SAP BTP account (USE WITH CARE!)

myusergroups.description: list of user groups to be used in btpsa
myusergroups.title: list of user groups to be used in btpsa

name.description: name of this usergroup (not BTP specific)
name.title: name of this usergroup

members.description: member of usergroup specified via email
members.title: member of usergroup

org.description: org name of the Cloud Foundry environment to be used for your use case
org.title: org name of the CF environment for use case

orgid.description: org id of the Cloudfoundry environment to be used for your use case
orgid.title: org id of the CF environment for use case

parameterfile.description: file to deliver all parameters within a single json file
parameterfile.title: parameters file for btp-setup-automator

pollingIntervalForKymaCreationInMinutes.description: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be created
pollingIntervalForKymaCreationInMinutes.title: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be created

pollingIntervalForKymaDeprovisioningInMi.description: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted
pollingIntervalForKymaDeprovisioningInMi.title: Polling interval in minutes when tool is waiting for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted

prunesubaccount.description: if set to True: same like -pruneusecase, but on-top deletes the subaccount. USE WITH CARE!!!
prunesubaccount.title: same like parameter 'pruneusecase', but on-top deletes the subaccount

pruneusecase.description: if set to True: deletes all assets of a usecase based on the collected info in the metadatafile. No confirmation message. USE WITH CARE!!!
pruneusecase.title: delete all assets of a usecase based on the collected info in the metadatafile

region.description: region for the SAP BTP sub account that should be used for the use case
region.title: region for SAP BTP subaccount

repeatstatusrequest.description: time in seconds to wait after requesting status info (pulling)
repeatstatusrequest.title: time in seconds to wait after requesting status info (pulling)

repeatstatustimeout.description: timeout in seconds after which requests should be stopped
repeatstatustimeout.title: timeout in seconds after which requests should be stopped

rundefaulttests.description: switch to run default tests at the beginning of the script (INTERNAL USAGE)
rundefaulttests.title: switch to run default tests at the beginning of the script

subaccountid.description: id of your sub account that should be used
subaccountid.title: subaccount id of SAP BTP sub account

subaccountname.description: name of your sub account in case you want to define a specific name for your sub account
subaccountname.title: sub account name for use case

subdomain.description: name of the subdomain of your sub account
subdomain.title: subdomain of sub account

suffixinstancename.description: suffix attached to each service instance that is created (e.g. hana_yoursuffixinstancename)
suffixinstancename.title: suffix attached to each service instance created

timeoutLimitForKymaCreationInMinutes.description: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be created
timeoutLimitForKymaCreationInMinutes.title: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be created

timeoutLimitForKymaDeprovisioningInMinut.description: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted
timeoutLimitForKymaDeprovisioningInMinut.title: Limit in minutes until the tool should wait for the Kyma instance to be deprovisioned/deleted

usedirectory.description: Should the tool create/use a directory for the subaccount?
usedirectory.title: Trigger creation/usage of a directory for the subaccount?

waitForKymaEnvironmentCreation.description: Should the tool wait for the creation of the Kyma environment
waitForKymaEnvironmentCreation.title: Should the tool wait for the creation of the Kyma environment
